definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
physical pain/lit. skin and flesh suffer

sentences.english: This nutrient superstar is found concentrated in the brightly colored skins and flesh of most foods in their natural form.
sentences.chinese: 该超级营养素在天然果蔬的色彩缤纷的皮肉中很多。

sentences.english: The human remains in those caves hadn't been de-fleshed, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而那些洞穴里的人类尸体并没有被剥离皮肉。

sentences.english: Rax is a kind of world-famous rabbit with high quality fur and meat.
sentences.chinese: 獭兔是世界著名的皮肉兼用兔品种。

sentences.english: She prostituted herself in order to support her children.
sentences.chinese: 她为养活子女而操皮肉生涯。

sentences.english: The flesh around the ankle had swollen up.
sentences.chinese: 脚踝四周的皮肉肿起来了。

sentences.english: Yes, sir. In the leg. It was a minor flesh wound.
sentences.chinese: 是，长官在腿部，只是轻微的皮肉伤。

sentences.english: There is a cold nip in the air.
sentences.chinese: 一股寒气透过他的皮肉直刺骨髓。

sentences.english: The guinea pig is precious flesh holds concurrently with multipurpose herbivores.
sentences.chinese: 豚鼠是珍贵的皮肉兼用的多用途草食动物。

sentences.english: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God
sentences.chinese: 我这皮肉灭绝之后，我必在肉体之外得见神。

sentences.english: I think these people must have undergone much sufferings of flesh in order to play skillfully.
sentences.chinese: 我想这些人肯定吃了不少皮肉之苦，才玩出花样来。

sentences.english: I am peeling the hemp to get fibers.
sentences.chinese: 我在刮苎麻的皮肉，取其纤维。

sentences.english: Others would have red-hot irons and pincers applied to their flesh.
sentences.chinese: 其他一些人则遭到热得通红的烙铁和钳子烙烫皮肉。

sentences.english: Trilingual deer skin is rare, the outcome will become a hero.
sentences.chinese: 皮肉俱佳的鹿实在难得，鹿死谁手谁就成了英雄。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
